oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CONFIGURATION-INTERACTION STUDIES USING BIORTHOGONAL APPROACH TO VB BASIS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KADOLKAR, C
SARMA, CR
RETTRUP, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: valence-bond theory
states
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the present article, we have attempted a systematic procedure for use of biorthogonal techniques to the configuration interaction studies in molecules using nonorthogonal valence bond (VB) orbitals. The procedure developed is integral-driven and a program based on this has been developed. Test runs of the program have been carried out in case of full and truncated configuration spaces. (C) 1995 John Wiley and Sons, Inc.
